config_description: GC Pauses greater than 200 ms will be logged at INFO level This threshold can be adjusted to minimize logging if necessary
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'gc_log_threshold_in_ms' sets a threshold for logging GC pauses greater than the specified value (in milliseconds) at INFO level. This threshold can be adjusted to control the amount of logging related to GC pauses.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a GC pause occurs that exceeds the specified threshold value. The frequency of triggering depends on the frequency and duration of GC pauses in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'gc_log_threshold_in_ms' configuration option on the system is related to the amount of logging generated for GC pauses. Setting a lower threshold value may result in more frequent logging of GC pauses, potentially impacting system performance due to increased logging overhead.
